title: At least 500 killed in Iran protests as Trump weighs intervention | ABC NEWS
description: Activists report that over 500 people have died in ongoing protests against the Iranian regime.  US President Donald Trump has cautioned Iranian leaders against using force and affirmed that the US is "ready to help."  In Australia, hundreds gathered in Sydney, calling on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to condemn the killings of protesters in Iran. title: Future of Adelaide Writers' Week 'hangs in the balance' | ABC NEWS
description: The future of Adelaide Writers' Week remains unclear as high-profile participants continue to pull out over the decision to exclude a pro-Palestinian author in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. The Adelaide Festival Board pointed to the author's past statements for its decision, but the academic at the centre of the saga has defended her social media post. title: Heartbroken residents take stock as Longwood bushfire victim identified | ABC NEWS
description: Cooler weather conditions are helping firefighters get on top of the bushfires still burning in Victoria. More than 350 buildings are known to have been destroyed in the blazes, with some residents returning to survey property damage and finding nothing but devastation. Max Hobson has been identified as the first victim of the fires. The cattle farmer was found dead around 100 metres from his vehicle beside a burnt-out road, north of Alexandra in central Victoria. title: Adelaide Festival board members, chair, quit amid controversy | ABC NEWS
description: The Adelaide Festival chair and several board members have resigned amid controversy over the cancellation of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from this year's Adelaide Writers' Week.  Reporting by Amal Wehbe, ABC News Social Media team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: NSW govt proposes council powers to shut down illegal prayer halls | ABC NEWS
description: Councils in NSW will have more power to shut down premises hosting "hate preachers" under new legislation proposed by the state government. Under the new laws, places of worship will be required to consult with NSW Police during the planning approval process. Councils will have authority to cut off utilities for illegally operating prayer halls, and fines for non-compliance will dramatically increase. title: Iran regime facing "apocalyptic" anti-government protests, says journalist | The World | ABC News
description: Protests in Iran are continuing, despite reports hundreds have been killed and thousands detained by police. But how big an impact are these protests having on the clerical rule of Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei?  Tara Kangarlou, a global affairs journalist and author of the Heartbeat of Iran, spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the mass anti-government demonstrations. title: Iranian government airs footage of pro-regime demonstrations | ABC NEWS
description: Iranian state media has broadcast video of mass rallies in support of the government, in an effort to contradict social media images showing mass protests against authorities. Tehran is accusing the US and Israel of fuelling unrest in the country, as Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi hit out at US President Donald Trump’s threat to strike Iranian government targets in solidarity with protesters.  The Iranian Revolutionary Guard claims the US president's move is a clear interference with the internal affairs of Iran.  The country’s exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi is encouraging demonstrators to continue protesting. title: Trump claims Russia or China will take over Greenland if the US doesn't | ABC NEWS
description: Greenland and Denmark have rejected a US bid to acquire the Arctic island ahead of their foreign ministers’ meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington DC.  US President Donald Trump claims Russia and China would take over the Danish territory if the US does not acquire it.  The US leader has refused to rule out military action to advance his cause, sparking concerns among Greenland, NATO and the European Union.  NATO Secretary General is calling for a diplomatic solution and a collective effort to protect Greenland from foreign threats. title: Ambassador Kevin Rudd to end posting to the United States a year early | ABC NEWS
description: Kevin Rudd will conclude his tenure as Australia’s ambassador to the United States, a year early at the end of March. He will be returning to the Asia Society as president and CEO. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese paid tribute to Rudd's work helping further the AUKUS pact and securing a critical minerals deal, playing a role in Julian Assange's 2024 release and building relationships across both sides of politics in the US. title: Former US Fed chairs rally behind Jerome Powell amid criminal probe | ABC NEWS
description: Three former chairpersons of the US Federal Reserve have voiced support for the incumbent Jerome Powell, after the Justice Department launched a criminal investigation about renovations for the  central bank's headquarters.  Mr Powell’s predecessors accused US President Donald trump of undermining the independence of the institution, after the US Federal Reserve chairperson claimed the probe was intended to pressure and intimidate him into lowering interest rates more rapidly.  White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt has defended the US president, saying he is entitled to criticise Jerome Powell under the First Amendment. title: Flood rescues as ex-TC Koji inundates central Queensland | ABC NEWS
description: A flood emergency warning remains in place for the central Queensland town of Clermont after ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji made landfall and moved inland. Three people were rescued overnight and dozens of properties have been impacted by floodwaters. More rain is forecast putting saturated communities on high alert. title: Explosives used to demolish Tasmania's Bell Bay power station smokestack | ABC NEWS
description: The last large structure on the site of the Bell Bay power station in Tasmania has been demolished, making way for a private company to build a methanol fuel plant.  The demolition was conducted by a specialist contractor using 41 kilograms of explosives.
